intro: Urginea echinostachya, commonly known as the horned star lily, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a tall, leafless stem that bears clusters of white or pale yellow blooms with prominent stamens. Its bulbs are large and fleshy, adapted for storing water in arid environments. Urginea echinostachya is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
